Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Aria \A"ri*a\, n. [It., fr. L. a["e]r. See {Air}.] (Mus.) An air or song; a melody; a tune. [1913 Webster]
Note: The Italian term is now mostly used for the more elaborate accompanied melodies sung by a single voice, in operas, oratorios, cantatas, anthems, etc., and not so much for simple airs or tunes. [1913 Webster]
aria n 1: an elaborate song for solo voice 2: an elaborate song for solo voice
